intro: Hieracium subaureum, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the daisy family (Asteraceae). It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and is native to Europe, particularly in regions such as France and Italy. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. It has a hairy stem and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces numerous small, showy flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium subaureum is often considered a weed but has historical uses in traditional medicine.
